data.enText: afraid; feeling fear
a frightened child
Don't be frightened.
What are you frightened of?

data.chText: 我害怕在黑夜单独走路回家。
data.enText: I'm frightened of walking home alone in the dark.
He sounded frightened.

data.chText: 现在我吓得不敢问他了。
data.enText: I'm too frightened to ask him now.
She was frightened that the plane would crash.
I'm frightened for him (= that he will be hurt, etc.) .

data.chText: 我绝不会干。我会吓死的。
data.enText: I'd never do that. I'd be frightened to death .

data.text: afraid ♦ frightened ♦ scared ♦ alarmed ♦ paranoid ♦ apprehensive

data.enText: All these words describe feeling or showing fear.
afraid

data.chText: 指害怕、担心不幸的事可能发生：
data.enText: [not before noun] feeling fear; worried that sth bad might happen
There's nothing to be afraid of.
Aren't you afraid (that) you'll fall?
frightened

data.chText: 指害怕、担心不幸的事可能发生：
data.enText: feeling fear; worried that sth bad might happen
a frightened child
She was frightened that the glass would break.
scared

data.chText: 指害怕、担心不幸的事可能发生：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) feeling fear; worried that sth bad might happen

data.chText: 小偷慌张起来，都跑掉了。
data.enText: The thieves got scared and ran away.

data.chText: scared较非正式，较常用于日常谈话中，常指有些害怕。afraid不用于名词前，只能与介词of而非about连用。afraid/frightened/scared of sb/sth/doing sth或afraid/frightened/scared to do sth均指担心受到伤害或遭受痛苦。frightened/scared about sth/doing sth较少指担心个人安全，更多的是指害怕不快的事情发生。
data.enText: Scared is more informal, more common in speech, and often describes small fears. Afraid cannot come before a noun. It can only take the preposition of , not about . If you are afraid/frightened/scared of sb/sth/doing sth or afraid/frightened/scared to do sth, you think you are in danger of being hurt or suffering in some way. If you are frightened/scared about sth/doing sth, it is less a fear for your personal safety and more a worry that sth unpleasant might happen.
afraid, frightened or scared?
alarmed

data.chText: 指担心危险或不快的事情发生：
data.enText: [not before noun] afraid that sth dangerous or unpleasant might happen

data.chText: 她一想到独自旅行的情景就害怕。
data.enText: She was alarmed at the prospect of travelling alone.
paranoid

data.chText: 指多疑、不合情理的恐惧：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) afraid or suspicious of other people and believing that they are trying to harm you, in a way that is not reasonable
You're just being paranoid.
apprehensive

data.chText: 指有点担心不好的事情可能发生：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) slightly afraid that sth bad might happen

data.chText: 我有点担心我说过的话的后果。
data.enText: I was a little apprehensive about the effects of what I had said.
Don't be afraid/frightened/scared/alarmed.
frightened/scared/paranoid/apprehensive about …
afraid/frightened/scared/apprehensive that …
afraid/frightened/scared of spiders, etc.
to feel/look/sound afraid/frightened/scared/alarmed/apprehensive
to get frightened/scared/paranoid
afraid/frightened/scared to open the door, etc.
be frightened/nervous/scared of your own shadow
to be very easily frightened; to be very nervous
be frightened/scared/terrified out of your wits
to be very frightened

example: the frightened child cowered in the corner
too shocked and scared to move

tr: thrown into a state of intense fear or desperation
example: became panicky as the snow deepened
trying to keep back the panic-stricken crowd

value.def: If you are frightened, you are anxious or afraid, often because of something that has just happened or that you think may happen.

example.ex: Miriam was too frightened to tell her family what had happened.
example.tran: 米丽娅姆太害怕了，不敢告诉家人发生了什么事。

gramarinfo.label: oft v-link ADJ <l>of</l> n/-ing, ADJ to-inf

value.boxu_tran: 注意不要混淆frightened 和 frightening。
value.boxu_usage: Take care not to confuse frightened and frightening.
